Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)204-6992.

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation An improper restraint performed by Staff 1 on Youth A.
Investigation Administrator 1 was interviewed on 12/05/2022 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced face-to-face visit. He informed Youth A was still
2

present at the facility and could be interviewed. Administrator 1 stated
that Staff 1 was on leave as a result of the incident.
Youth A was interviewed on 12/05/2022 with DHHS Worker 1 and Law
Enforcement during an unannounced face-to-face visit. He stated that
he has been at the facility for 4 1/2 months and has been in Unit 2 the
entire time. Youth A stated that the alleged incident started at about
7:15 PM on 12/03/2022. Youth A recalled the beginning of the alleged
incident in that another youth, Youth C, was trying to fight him. He
stated he came out of his unit and attempted to get to the other unit
where Youth C resides. Youth A recalled that Staff 1 was in the other
unit as he approached, and Staff 1 noticed Youth A and came outside
of that unit and shut the door. Youth A remembered that Staff 1 was
trying to get some paper to put over the window of the unit. Youth A
stated that at that point he was trying to get into the unit and break the
door handle. He remembered Staff 1 stating “What are you doing?” and
Youth A stated that he was ignoring him. Youth A then recalled that
Staff 1 grabbed him by the throat and started choking him. He said that
Staff 1 had both hands around his neck. Youth A then stated that his
head was slammed against the brick wall five or six times by Staff 1. As
a scuffle ensued, Youth A stated that the entire incident lasted about a
half a minute and Staff 1 briefly let him go. Youth A stated that he then
pushed Staff 1 out of the way and ran through the common area and
out of the building. Youth A believed that there was no one out in the
hallway or common area as he ran out. Youth A stated that Staff 1 then
followed him outside as Youth A broke a few exterior windows. Youth A
remembered that other staff, including Supervisor 1, came out and at
that point, Staff 1 was removed from the situation and sent home.
Youth A said he had never had a physical incident like this with Staff 1
before, only that they had gotten into verbal arguments, but nothing that
escalated further. He also stated that he has not seen any other youth
get into physical altercations with Staff 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed during an unannounced face to face visit to the
facility on 12/05/2022 with DHHS Worker 1 and Law Enforcement.
Staff 1 confirmed that he was a part of the alleged incident that
occurred the prior Saturday, 12/03/2022. He stated that this occurred
around 8 PM. Staff 1 recalled that he started the medication passing
process to youth. He stated that he was in the main common area
within the building, and that Youth A was in Unit 2, and then he saw
Youth A move quickly towards Unit 1. Staff 1 denied that he was
already in Unit 1 when Youth A came up to the locked door. Staff 1
believed that he was alone in the common area at the time, and that he
was near the Program Manager's office. Staff 1 recalled that he tried to
talk to Youth A to de-escalate him, but was quickly unsuccessful.
Because Youth A was not listening to him, Staff 1 stated that he
4

grabbed some paper from the Program Manager‘s office to cover the
windows of the unit Youth A wanted to get in to, hoping that would help
de-escalate him. He said he attempted to hang paper up but wasn’t
able to because he didn’t have enough tape. Staff 1 stated that, at that
point, he stood in front of the door to be in Youth A’s way, so he cannot
see into the unit. He believed that Youth A was trying to get to another
youth within the unit that he had issues with. Staff 1 remembered Youth
A getting very upset and attempted to push him. Staff 1 remembered
Youth A taking a swing at him in an attempt to punch him at that point.
Staff 1 stated he put out his arms to push Youth A away from him and
Youth A attempted to punch him several more times. Staff 1 believed
that he then pushed Youth A toward the wall next to the door of the unit
they were near. Because there were no other staff or youth around,
Staff 1 stated that he did not have anyone to ask for help. Staff 1
believed that Youth A’s back was against the wall. At that point Staff 1
stated that he held Youth A down against the lower part of the wall and
he crouched over the top of and behind Youth A in an attempt to help
him calm down. He remembered holding Youth A’s chest and denied
that his hands were ever near his neck. Staff 1 then stated that he was
holding Youth A’s shoulders and back during this part of the incident as
well, effectively pinning him against the wall. He did not believe Youth A
ever was unable to breathe. Staff 1 recalled that Youth A was able to
break free from him and that Youth A quickly ran outside and started
throwing rocks at outside windows. Staff 1 stated that he and Staff 2
followed Youth A outside. Staff 1 recalled that Supervisor 1 met them
outside and talked through the incident with him and asked him to go
home for the day. Staff 1 stated that he knows that the way he put his
hands on Youth A and the position that Youth A ended up in was not a
part of the Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI) restraint model that the
facility utilizes. He believed he was acting in self-defense, and he
denied that Youth A was hurt in any way.
At the conclusion of the interviews on 12/05/2022, law enforcement
confirmed that they were not going to proceed with filing charges as a
result of the incident.
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were interviewed on 12/14/2022 with
DHHS Worker 1 during a face-to-face announced visit to the facility. All
three youth stated that they did not witness the incident because they
were in their respective units, and this occurred during a time when
they were not out in the hallways or common area. All three youth
stated that they had witnessed times when Youth A had gotten into
fights with other youth or staff. They all consistently stated that they had
not seen Staff 1 be physical like was alleged with any other youth
during their time at the facility.
4

Staff 2 was interviewed on 12/14/2022 with DHHS Worker 1 during in
announced face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 2 stated that at the
time of the incident he was in Youth A’s unit. Because of some
difficulties with youth behavior, all the units had to leave the common
area after watching a movie and return to their units. He recalled that
he saw Youth A in an upset state, but he could not remember why.
Staff 2 recalled seeing Youth A leave the unit, but he was not able to
follow because he had to stay in the unit with other youth. Eventually he
saw Youth A run out of the building and saw Staff 1 running behind him.
Staff 2 recalled hearing Youth A state, “you hit me” and hearing Staff 1
state the same thing back to Youth A. At that point, Youth A was
throwing rocks at windows and it took Staff 2 and other staff to de-
escalate Youth A after law enforcement was contacted. Staff 2 stated
that he did not notice any injuries on Youth A in the immediate
aftermath. While attempting to de-escalate Youth A, Staff 2
remembered that Youth A ran away from the building, and Staff 2
stayed where he was. Staff 2 recalled that he has never had any
issues working with Staff 1, and did not believe he had ever been in a
physical altercation like was alleged with any other youth.
Therapist 1 was interviewed on 10/14/2022 with DHHS Worker 1
during a face-to-face announced visit to the facility. He confirmed that
he was the therapist working with Youth A. Therapist 1 stated that he
did not see Youth A the day of the incident but did see him for a regular
session on the following Tuesday. Therapist 1 recalled that Youth A
stated that Staff 1 slammed his head against the wall, and that his head
hurt, he could not recall if Youth A stated that Staff 1 choked him.
Therapist 1 stated that Youth A had no visible injuries that he could
see.
Administrator 1 was spoken with DHHS Worker 1 during the face-to-
face announced visit to the facility on 12/14/2022. He confirmed that
Staff 1 employment had been terminated.
Staff 3 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/14/2022 during the
face-to-face announced visit to the facility. Staff 3 recalled that Youth A
stated that Staff 1 choked him and hit his head against the wall. At that
point, Staff 3 called Supervisor 1 in an attempt to help de-escalate
Youth A and resolve the situation. Youth A stated that he would go sit
outside the entrance to the facility until Supervisor 1 came. Eventually,
Youth A came inside with Supervisor 1. Staff 3 stated that he didn’t
notice any bruising, but Youth A did have some red dots on the crown
of his forehead. Staff 3 stated that was the end of his involvement with
Youth A after that incident.
4

Supervisor 1/Complainant was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on
12/14/2022 during an announced face-to-face visit. She recalled that
her involvement in the alleged incident started when Staff 3 called her
and asked her to talk to Youth A as they were outside. She stated she
came into work to talk to Youth A. Youth A willingly came inside with
her when she arrived. She recalled that Youth A said that Staff 1
bumped his head into the wall, but she did not think he said anything
about choking. Supervisor 1 confirmed that she was the staff that had
sent Staff 1 home and asked to have Youth A sent to the hospital to be
checked out. Supervisor 1 stated that she had not had any concerns
with Staff 1 prior to this incident.
Documents that were reviewed over the course of this
investigation:
- Employee personnel file for Staff 1. No discipline was noted. Staff 1
was last trained in TCI on 09/21/2022 and this was timely.
- Incident report dated 12/03/2022. This report was consistent with
interviews conducted.
- Medical documentation for Youth A dated 12/03/2022 and 12/05/2022.
This documentation confirmed no injuries for Youth A and provided
discharge instructions, including over-the-counter pain, medication, and
anti-inflammatories.
- Written statement gathered by the facility from Staff 1 dated
12/03/2022. This statement was consistent with his interview.
- Police report from Vassar Police Department dated 12/28/2022
confirming no charges were filed against Staff 1.
- Behavior Support and Management Policy from Clarence Fischer
Center, last revised 08/15/2022. This policy states that the only
approved methods of restraint approved by the facility are: supine
restraints, standing restraint, and small child restraints. The way Staff 1
physically contacted Youth A during the incident is not in accordance
with those approved restraints.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as Staff 1 and Youth A both
reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A during the incident.
Conclusion Violation Established
